page.title: 02TOAT HOUSE, NORTH PULBOROUH
page.content: Toat House lies between the Toat Monument and the River Arun. The house was originally a 14th century "hall" house and the residence of the Lord of the Manor of Pulborough. In the grounds of the house is a chapel,formed from former outbuildings in 1900, in memory of the death of a child of the family. Some of the estate of 300 acres was orchard but these have now been grubbed up and grass sown. The dairy farm consists of about 100 Freisian milkers and 100 followers. The owners hope to breed Charollais cattle in the future. The owners also breed racehorses and have five brood mares under the stud name "MOORESTYLE". The estate includes Toat Wood, a typical oakwood of mature trees which is the haunt of badgers and foxes.
